Edited June 8, 2014 by r4pt0r

Allow me to shamelessly quote myself, from a PM I wrote a while back to someone who had the same question:

Yes, there's a reason people can't post polls in Suggestions & Development Discussion and that is that people tend to attach a poll with their suggestions, and use the results (which are by definition very skewed) as a reason Squad should implement a certain suggestion. For example, if I were to post a thread called 'Resource mining' and attach a poll to that asking people if they think Squad should add it, I can predict that 90% of people would probably agree with this, and this goes for any topic. The reason here is that people who aren't interested in the topic of resource mining will probably not open the thread, much less vote on the poll, which means you'll end up with the aforementioned skewed results. Because at some point last year this thing was happening a lot, together with all sorts of comments such as: "Squad, look at the poll, 85% of the people want this feature! You need to implement it!" it was decided to disable polls for this forum.

Long story short: the polls really don't represent the general interest fairly, and a good discussion gives a lot more insight into what people want than a quick poll. The thread you linked is of limited use in any case, since Squad plans the updates a long time in advance. In fact, I think most things up until 0.25 at least were planned last year during Kerbalkon.
thank you for the response. makes sense. enjoy your sunday.
